episodeTitle: Awakening After 500 Years!! Oars Opens His Eyes!!
description: Gecko Moria implants Luffy's shadow into the ancient giant corpse of Oars, bringing the massive zombie to life. The revived Oars exhibits Luffy's personality, demanding food and declaring his dream to become Pirate King. Meanwhile, Absalom abducts Nami for marriage while Usopp and Chopper battle zombie soldiers until Franky and Robin arrive to assist.

events.title: Moria Implants Luffy's Shadow into Oars
events.description: Gecko Moria uses his Kage Kage no Mi powers to forcibly implant Monkey D. Luffy's stolen shadow into the corpse of the ancient giant Oars. The shadow struggles but Moria overpowers it and makes it swear loyalty before placing it into the massive zombie body.
events.significance: This creates the most powerful zombie in Moria's army by combining Luffy's fighting spirit and abilities with Oars' legendary strength and size. It demonstrates the full extent of Moria's shadow manipulation powers and sets up the arc's climactic conflict.

quotes.text: No matter how much the shadow struggles, it will obey me!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria forces Luffy's shadow to submit before implanting it into Oars

events.title: Oars Awakens After 500 Years
events.description: The corpse of Oars the Continent-Puller, an infamous ancient giant who died over 500 years ago, opens his eyes for the first time since his resurrection. The massive zombie breaks free from the chains restraining him in the freezer as Luffy's shadow brings him back to life.
events.significance: This marks the debut of one of the most powerful antagonists in the Thriller Bark arc and the largest zombie in Moria's army. Oars' awakening represents the culmination of Moria's plan to create an unstoppable zombie warrior by combining an ancient giant's body with Luffy's shadow and fighting abilities.

events.title: Oars' First Words: Demanding Meat
events.description: Immediately upon awakening, Oars bellows 'MEEEEEEAAAAAATTTTTT!!! I'M HUNNNNGGRRRRRRYYYYYYYYYYYY!!!' with tremendous force, creating shockwaves that blow characters throughout the castle. He then calls out for Sanji to make him food, but becomes confused as he doesn't remember who Sanji is.
events.significance: This moment perfectly demonstrates how Luffy's shadow has transferred his personality traits to Oars, including his insatiable appetite and knowledge of crew members. It also shows the comedic contrast between the fearsome ancient giant and Luffy's carefree nature. The confusion about Sanji's identity reveals that shadow personalities and memories gradually fade over time.

quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars' very first words upon awakening, exhibiting Luffy's personality

quotes.text: Sanji! Make me some food! ...Wait, who's Sanji?
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars calls for Sanji but doesn't remember who he is as the shadow's memories begin to fade

events.title: Shadow Personality Transfer Explained
events.description: Chopper realizes and explains to the others that Dr. Hogback is creating zombies and that the shadows implanted in them carry the personalities and abilities of their original owners. However, these memories and personality traits gradually wear away over time, as evidenced by Oars' confusion about who Sanji is.
events.significance: This revelation explains the mechanics of Moria's zombie creation process and the Kage Kage no Mi devil fruit powers. It establishes why the zombies act like their shadow donors and why Moria needs fresh shadows. This is crucial world-building information about how the Thriller Bark operation functions.

quotes.text: Dr. Hogback is the one making the zombies! They steal personalities with the shadows inside them. Hogback is using people like pawns!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper deduces the truth about zombie creation

events.title: Oars Refuses to Obey Moria
events.description: When Gecko Moria commands Oars to become his underling and serve him as a Warlord of the Sea's subordinate, Oars silences the other zombies with a glare and flatly refuses. He declares that he has no intention of following orders and decides to leave for the sea on his own terms.
events.significance: This demonstrates that despite Moria's shadow manipulation, Luffy's strong-willed personality has influenced Oars to the point where he rejects authority and commands, mirroring Luffy's own independent nature. This defiance creates a major problem for Moria's plans and shows the limitations of his zombie control when using powerful personalities.

quotes.text: I'm not going to be anyone's underling!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars refuses Moria's command to serve him

events.title: Oars Declares He Will Become Pirate King
events.description: After punching through the freezer wall and leaping outside, Oars attempts to stretch his arm but realizes it doesn't work. Despite this confusion, he proclaims that he will become the Pirate King, directly inheriting Luffy's core dream and ambition through the shadow.
events.significance: This is a pivotal moment showing that Luffy's dream has literally been transplanted into another being. It creates a dark mirror of Luffy - a massive, powerful zombie with the same ambition but none of the moral compass. This declaration sets up the philosophical conflict about what it truly means to chase this dream.

quotes.text: My arm should have stretched... Anyway, I'm going to become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars is confused about his body but declares Luffy's dream

events.title: Straw Hats Discovered by Thriller Bark Pirates
events.description: Usopp, Nami, and Chopper make loud noises while reacting to Oars' awakening, alerting Absalom and Perona to their presence. Gyoro, Nin, and Bao block their exit as the Mysterious Four close in on their position.
events.significance: This marks the end of the Straw Hats' stealth mission in the mansion and forces them into direct confrontation with Moria's commanders. It sets up multiple simultaneous battles and the abduction of Nami.

events.title: Usopp Uses Rokuren Mamushi Boshi
events.description: As Absalom uses his Suke Suke no Mi powers to turn invisible and abduct Nami, Usopp fires his Rokuren Mamushi Boshi (Six Chamber Pit-Viper Star) attack from his Kabuto weapon. Six explosive projectiles are shot simultaneously in a snake-like pattern, but Absalom's invisibility allows him to evade the attack.
events.significance: This marks the anime debut of Usopp's Rokuren Mamushi Boshi technique, demonstrating his improved arsenal with the Kabuto slingshot. While the attack fails against Absalom, it showcases Usopp's tactical evolution and his attempts to protect his crewmates.

quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp attempts to stop Absalom from taking Nami

events.title: Absalom Abducts Nami
events.description: Using his Suke Suke no Mi devil fruit powers, Absalom turns himself and Nami invisible, then abducts her with the intention of making her his bride. He also lights Usopp and Chopper on fire during the attack, leaving them to fend off zombie soldiers while he escapes with Nami.
events.significance: This begins Nami's kidnapping subplot which becomes a major motivation for the Straw Hats. It showcases Absalom's creepy obsession and the threat he poses with his invisibility powers. This event directly leads to Sanji's confrontation with Absalom and one of the arc's key battles.

quotes.text: You'll make a perfect bride, Nami!
quotes.speaker: Absalom
quotes.context: Absalom declares his intentions as he kidnaps Nami

events.title: Usopp and Chopper Surrounded by Zombie Soldiers
events.description: After Absalom's departure with Nami, Usopp and Chopper find themselves surrounded by a platoon of General Zombies and Soldier Zombies who attack them seeking their shadows. The two Straw Hats are set on fire and forced to fight for survival against the undead horde.
events.significance: This demonstrates the overwhelming numbers advantage that Moria's zombie army has and puts Usopp and Chopper in serious danger. It sets up the rescue by Franky and Robin who arrive with crucial knowledge about the zombies' weakness to salt.

events.title: Franky and Robin Rescue with Salt Purification
events.description: Franky and Robin arrive just in time to save Usopp and Chopper from the zombie platoon. Using salt that they learned is the zombies' weakness, they purify the undead creatures by forcing the shadows out of their bodies. However, they fail to rescue Nami who has already been taken by Absalom.
events.significance: This is the first time the Straw Hats successfully use salt against the zombies, demonstrating they've learned the key weakness of Moria's army. It reunites four of the crew members and establishes salt as the primary weapon against regular zombies. The failure to save Nami emphasizes the urgency of finding her.

events.title: Oars Demonstrates Luffy's Abilities
events.description: Oars exhibits confusion when his arm doesn't stretch as expected, revealing that he has inherited not just Luffy's personality and memories but also his expectations of having Gomu Gomu no Mi abilities. Despite being in a regular giant body, Oars believes he should be able to use rubber powers.
events.significance: This creates an interesting limitation for Oars - while he has Luffy's fighting spirit, knowledge, and techniques, he cannot actually use the Gomu Gomu no Mi powers since they belong to Luffy's body, not his shadow. This confusion will affect how Oars fights and adapts his combat style.

quotes.text: Huh? My arm should have stretched!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars is confused when his body doesn't behave like Luffy's rubber body

quotes.text: Sanji! Make me some food! ...Wait, who's Sanji?
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars calls for Sanji but doesn't remember who he is

quotes.text: I'm going to become the Pirate King!
quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars declares Luffy's dream as his own

quotes.text: Dr. Hogback is the one making the zombies! They steal personalities with the shadows inside them. Hogback is using people like pawns!
quotes.speaker: Tony Tony Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper realizes the truth about zombie creation

themes.description: The episode explores questions of identity through Oars, who possesses Luffy's personality, memories, and dreams but exists in a completely different body. This raises philosophical questions about what makes someone who they are.
themes.symbolism: Oars represents a dark mirror of Luffy - having his ambition and personality but none of the experiences or bonds that shaped them. The shadow transfer shows how personality can be separated from the body.
culturalReferences: Frankenstein parallels - creating life from death

themes.description: Oars inheriting Luffy's dream to become Pirate King demonstrates how powerful and fundamental this ambition is to Luffy's very being. Even when extracted and placed in a zombie, the dream persists.
themes.symbolism: The dream transcends the physical form, showing it as a core element of Luffy's soul/shadow.

themes.description: Multiple characters lose control in this episode - Luffy loses his shadow against his will, Oars is forced to live again without consent, and Nami is kidnapped. The theme of bodily autonomy and consent runs throughout.
themes.symbolism: The shadow manipulation represents violation of personal agency and freedom.

characterSpotlights.development: Oars is introduced as an ancient giant brought back to life with Luffy's shadow. He exhibits a fascinating mix of Luffy's personality (love of meat, dream of becoming Pirate King, independent spirit) while gradually losing specific memories. His confusion about his body not stretching and his refusal to obey Moria establish him as an unpredictable force.
keyActions: Refuses to obey Gecko Moria's commands
Declares he will become Pirate King
quotes: I'm going to become the Pirate King!
I'm not going to be anyone's underling!

characterSpotlights.development: Moria completes his master plan by implanting Luffy's shadow into Oars, creating what should be his ultimate weapon. However, his plan immediately shows flaws when Oars refuses to follow orders, demonstrating Moria's overconfidence and lack of understanding of strong-willed personalities.
keyActions: Implants the shadow into Oars' corpse
quotes: No matter how much the shadow struggles, it will obey me!

characterSpotlights.development: Nami becomes the target of Absalom's obsession and is kidnapped to be his unwilling bride. This puts her in immediate danger and motivates the crew to action.
keyActions: Gets discovered by the Thriller Bark Pirates

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper uses his medical knowledge to deduce how the zombie creation process works, explaining to the crew that shadows carry personalities and that Dr. Hogback is responsible for the zombies. This is crucial information for understanding their enemy.
keyActions: Gets rescued by Franky and Robin
quotes: Dr. Hogback is the one making the zombies! They steal personalities with the shadows inside them.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp attempts to protect Nami using his improved Kabuto weapon and new techniques, but fails against Absalom's invisibility. He shows bravery in the face of overwhelming odds.
keyActions: Attempts to stop Absalom with Rokuren Mamushi Boshi
Gets rescued by Franky and Robin

characterSpotlights.development: Franky arrives with Robin to save Usopp and Chopper, demonstrating his knowledge of the zombies' weakness to salt.
Robin works alongside Franky to save their crewmates, using salt to eliminate zombie threats.
Absalom executes his plan to kidnap Nami for marriage, using his Suke Suke no Mi powers to become invisible and evade Usopp's attacks.
keyActions: Sets Usopp and Chopper on fire
quotes: You'll make a perfect bride, Nami!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Oars' awakening sequence with additional reaction shots from the Straw Hats and Thriller Bark residents that weren't in the manga.
The anime adds more detail to the zombie battle sequence with Usopp and Chopper before Franky and Robin arrive.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts manga Chapter 457, pages 2-17, making it one of the slower-paced episodes in terms of manga coverage during the Thriller Bark arc.
Oars is voiced by the same voice actors as Luffy (Mayumi Tanaka in Japanese, Colleen Clinkenbeard in English) since he has Luffy's shadow and personality.
The episode aired on April 27, 2008 in Japan and received a 6.4% TV rating, ranking 8th in its timeslot.

Oars' name comes from the Japanese pronunciation of 'Oz', which may reference the classic story The Wonderful Wizard of Oz, particularly given the theme of seeking something (Luffy's dream) that was lost.
The opening 'Jungle P' by 5050 was still being used for this episode. The 'P' in the title stands for 'Party', fitting the Straw Hats' adventurous spirit.

This episode marks the first time in the series where Luffy's dream of becoming Pirate King is literally transferred to another being, creating a philosophical question about the nature of dreams and identity.
